title: Community Health Worker Supervisor - Outreach
description:
**Position: Program Coordinator - Community Outreach**


**Work Location: Sunset Park**


**Hours: Full Time - Monday - Friday 35 hours per week Ability to work some evening and weekend hours required**


**Salary Range: 60,000-62,400**


**Program Summary:**


**This program supports unhoused individuals living on the streets by addressing their basic needs and providing essential services, linkages, and referrals. Additionally, it offers safer sex education and substance use support and information.**


**Position Summary:**


**Under the supervision of the Program Director, the Program Coordinator will oversee Community Health Workers and a Peer Trainer as part of a comprehensive outreach program. This program delivers education, testing, counseling, showers, and referrals to unhoused individuals living on the streets in high-risk communities, focusing on preventing HIV, Hepatitis C, and substance use.**


**Responsibilities:**


* **Provide consistent supervision and management for all aspects of high quality program services delivery to clients that are unhoused and living on the streets in accordance with funder and regulatory requirements; best practices; BCS policies and Core Values. Serve as a role model to all stakeholders.**
* **Provide weekly supervision to CHWs and Peer trainer**
* **Work collaboratively with the Program Director to submit monthly and quarterly reports to funders.**
* **Will work closely with drop in centers, safe haven, substance abuse detox and rehabilitation programs and medical providers to link clients to services while providing training education and HIV testing for the unhoused population.**
* **Ensure that Community Health Workers are providing HIV and Hepatitis C Testing, education and training to individuals living on the streets.**
* **Ensure that CHWs are distributing high-risk prevention supplies, including female & male condoms, safer hygiene kits, first aid, opioid overdose prevention, fentanyl testing strip kits, and provision of sterile syringes to targeted populations..**
* **Help people understand their at risk behaviors and develop strategies to improve their health and well-being through HIV and Hep. C testing, education supportive counseling and follow-up**
* **Over see that all data is being input in programmatic databases (AIRS, Apricot, etc)**
* **Coordinate community-based events including outreach and education (e.g., program brochures, tabling, Naloxone training and distribution, community wellness activities)**
* **Build community trust through service-based work and relationship-building**
* **Deliver health information using culturally appropriate terms and concepts**
* **Ensure that CHWs are linking people to health care and social service resources including health insurance, food, housing, quality care and health information.**
* **Facilitate groups and workshops**
* **Follow organization’s protocols for safety and confidentiality guidelines.**
* **Participate in Team and departmental meetings**
* **Completing required number of annual training hours.**

**Qualifications:**


* **Bachelor’s degree with at least one year of health/social services experience or Associates degree with three years health/social services experience**
* **Supervisory and management skills required**
* **Valid Driver’s license**
* **Preferred certification to perform HIV and Hepatitis C testing and counseling**
* **Demonstrated ability to manage time and projects and submit work in a complete, on time and accurate manner.**
* **Interpersonal skills necessary for teamwork, decision-making and management and to work collaboratively and effectively within a team.**
* **Demonstrated ability to respond with sensitivity and confidentiality in compliance with HIPAA and other regulations.**
* **Demonstrated ability to effectively work with people from diverse backgrounds in reducing cultural and socio-economic barriers between clients and institutions.**
* **Familiarity with Motivational Interviewing approach helpful**

**BCS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Auxiliary aids and services are available upon request to individuals with disabilities**

title: RN Manger for Intake position- Full-Time- Mount Vernon, NY
description:
Our client, A Leading Health Care Agency, is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Intake Nurse Manager to join their team. The Intake RN Manager will be responsible for supervising, instructing, and guiding intake coordinators and auxiliary personnel in the referral intake process. This role involves designing and implementing efficient work processes to ensure seamless communication between departments, referral sources, and physicians. Play a key role in ensuring efficient referral processes that enhance patient care and satisfaction.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Supervision & Leadership:** Supervise, instruct, and guide intake coordinators and auxiliary personnel to ensure high-quality referral intake and follow-through.
* **Process Design & Implementation:** Develop and implement efficient work processes to facilitate sound communication between departments, referral sources, and physicians.
* **Team Management:** Provide ongoing support and guidance to the intake team, fostering a collaborative and efficient work environment.
* **Performance Monitoring:** Monitor and evaluate the performance of intake staff, ensuring compliance with organizational standards and implementing improvements as needed.
* **Communication Facilitation:** Ensure effective and timely communication between all stakeholders involved in the referral process.

**Qualifications:**

* **Experience:**

Minimum of 2 years of experience in a Certified Home Health Agency (CHHA) intake department.

At least 1 year of supervisory experience in a related field.

* **Technical Skills:**

Proficiency with Allscripts or similar electronic health record (EHR) systems.

* **Additional Skills:**

Strong leadership and communication skills.

Ability to design and implement efficient work processes.

Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Pay: $130,000.00 - $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid sick time
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Home Health

Supplemental Pay:

* Bonus opportunities

Experience:

* Nursing: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* BLS Certification (Preferred)
* RN (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Mount Vernon, NY (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Mount Vernon, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Mobile Wellness Navigator
description:
**Position: Mobile Outreach Navigator/Technician**

**Reports to: Program Coordinator**

**Location: 132 32nd Street Suite 123 Brooklyn NY 11232.**

**Salary Range: $50,000 - $50,000**


**Program Summary:**

**This program supports vulnerable and unhoused individuals living on the streets by addressing their basic needs and providing essential services, linkages, and referrals. Additionally, it offers safer sex education, HIV and HepC testing, and substance use support.**

**Role:**

**We are seeking a reliable and dedicated Mobile technician to operate and maintain our shower bus, HIV-testing RV, and company van. This role involves transporting these vehicles to various locations, ensuring their cleanliness and proper functioning, and engagement related to HIV, Hepatitis C, substance use, and preventive services to unhoused individuals.**

**The Mobile Technician will also support the team to build individual and community capacity by increasing health knowledge and self-sufficiency through a range of activities such as outreach, community education, informal counseling, social support, and advocacy.**

**Responsibilities:**

* **Provides program services delivery to clients from high-risk populations following funder and regulatory requirements; best practices; BCS policies and Core Values; Serve as a role model to all stakeholders and clients served.**
* **Safely drive the shower bus, HIV testing RV, and company van to designated locations.**
* **Regularly clean and maintain the interior and exterior of all vehicles to ensure they are hygienic and in good working condition.**
* **Assist with setting up and managing services provided by the vehicles, including showers and HIV testing.**
* **Crowd control during community events.**
* **Adhere to all safety and health regulations, ensuring that vehicles are compliant with legal and operational standards.**
* **Assist with the maintenance of accurate records of vehicle usage, maintenance schedules, and service reports.**
* **Escort clients to various appointments when needed**
* **Ensuring adherence to confidentiality regulations and HIPAA documentation**


* **Participate in Team and departmental meetings and complete the required number of annual training hours**
* **Linkage development with local health and social service organizations**


* **Follow Funders safety guidelines as trained for handling biohazard waste.**


* **Conduct medical waste disposal practices**


* **Prepared to respond appropriately to emergencies that may be encountered in the field per training received including overdoses**
* **Preparation, packing, and inventory of syringes and related program supplies.**
* **Ability to distribute high-risk prevention supplies, including female & male condoms, safer hygiene kits, and provision of sterile syringes.**
* **Assist in stocking mobile outreach vehicles.**
* **Attend and help outreach at community events**
* **Participation in BCS activities and events**
* **Working weekend and evening hours with flexibility as directed by the program needs ? Other duties as assigned by management staff**

**Qualifications Required:**

* **High School Diploma or GED**


* **Valid NYS driver’s license with a clean driving record.**
* **Proven experience in operating and maintaining vehicles, preferably in a social services or outreach setting.**
* **Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively with unhoused individuals and service providers.**
* **Ability to work independently and manage time effectively.**
* **Flexibility to work varying hours and travel to different locations as needed.**


* **Must have excellent English written and verbal skills.**
* **Knowledge of HIV, Hepatitis C, and substance use issues, including how to connect individuals with relevant services.**
* **Comfortable working with individuals that are unhoused, active substance use and or mental illness.**
* **Previous experience working in public health, social services, or related fields.**
* **Familiarity with preventive health services and linkage to care programs.**
* **Basic computer literacy.**


* **Bi-Lingual Spanish speaking is preferred**

**BCS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Auxiliary aids and services are available upon request of individuals with disabilities**

title: Director - Business Blueprint Strategy and Program Management
description:
**You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.**



With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.



At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.



Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.



The core of our company is not just the products we offer, but the personal connections our customers have with our brand. You can create digital experiences – from payments to rewards to servicing – that keep us connected to our customers and serve them at every touchpoint. From digital servicing and lifestyle features to secure, frictionless payment options, you can make a meaningful difference in our customers’ lives and help set us apart in the industry. Find your place in digital product on team Amex.


Business Blueprint aims to serve American Express Small Business customers in managing their cash flow needs through a differentiated set of products like Business Line of Credit, Business Checking, and small business Cards.


**Your mission:**



Serve as a Product Strategy Director and thought leader to define and execute on the Business Blueprint product strategy. You will be responsible for defining and driving short- to long-term strategy of Business Blueprint for US small business customers. You will demonstrate a proven ability in leading strategic growth initiatives end-to-end, building business cases, facilitating executive storytelling, closely collaborating with design, product development and engineering, managing cross-functional partner teams, and building metrics to measure success. You will also be able to manage multiple concurrent priorities, partner across the enterprise to understand the evolution of capabilities to inform small business roadmap. Additionally, you will lead the program management office responsible for road map and strategic prioritization, and project management.



**What** **you'll** **be doing:**



* Define and execute on short- to long-term strategy for Business Blueprint
* Partner with business unit Design teams to conduct competitive and customer research and analysis
* Collaborate with product development leaders and teams to build a roadmap
* Identify and prioritize insights-related growth initiatives / features on Business Blueprint Platform
* Identify, evaluate, and concisely communicate rationale for strategic growth initiatives that accelerate the expansion of Blueprint Platform’s holistic SME customer value-prop
* Write business cases for new strategies including customer and business impact and support the definition and development of go-to-market plans
* Lead projects independently end-to-end. Build consensus while also identifying risks and removing roadblocks
* Lead investment planning for Business Blueprint; partner with the Platform leadership team to identify priorities and coordinate accordingly with Small Business Products Strategy team
* Own and create strategic content SLT updates, quarterly business unit reviews and executive presentations
* Set-up organizational structure for Blueprint team managing prioritization
* Primary POC for controls, compliance, risk related items for Blueprint


**What** **we're** **looking for in you:**



* Operate Autonomously: Takes a project from ideation to delivery. Able to prioritize in ambiguous situations
* Proactive: Always striving to deliver great products. Proactive, self-driven, curious, loves learning
* Communication: Excellent written and oral communication skills. Communicates information, ideas, and concepts clearly
* Organization and Planning: Plans, organizes, and schedules in an efficient, productive manner; focuses on key priorities; manages time well
* Flexibility/Adaptability: Can manage quickly changing priorities and conditions; copes effectively with complexity and change
* Persistence: Follows through on items without being managed. Resourceful, has grit, and a positive “can do” attitude
* Leadership: Sound interpersonal skills and proven ability to navigate in a cross-functional setup
* Expertise: In the know about the latest and greatest happenings in banking, cards, and small business. Understand the competitive landscape
* Partnership: Collaborate with partners across the enterprise and across the team to deliver the best experiences for small business customers
* Data centric: Has experience with and understanding of analytics and data based products
* Results Driven - Ability to drive results in a complex, matrixed environment, and strong strategic skill set. Strategy expertise
* Ability to hire, coach and mentor team
**Minimum Qualifications:**



* 6+ years of experience in some combination of product strategy, product development, strategy, digital product or management consulting
* 4+ years of experience in financial services
* Track-record of successfully supporting strategic initiatives, including the development of business cases
* Exceptional communication and presentation skills with proven ability to communicate effectively across levels
* Ability to break down complex problems in simple ways and build enthusiasm around strategic initiatives
* Experience coordinating between Product, Business and Technology teams to define, prioritize, & deliver projects
* Self-starter and solutions-driven, with a willingness to learn and adapt to new responsibilities
* Comfort in a fast-paced and high growth environment
* Effectively challenges the status quo and able to respectively voice a contrasting point of view
* Software application skills - proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint
* Bachelor’s degree


**Preferred Qualifications:**



* 8+ years of experience in some combination of product strategy, product development, strategy, or management consulting
* 5+ years of experience in financial services, with expertise in payments and/or banking
* Master's degree a plus


Salary Range: $130,000.00 to $205,000.00 annually + bonus + equity (if applicable) + benefits



The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.



We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:


* Competitive base salaries
* Bonus incentives
* 6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
* Free financial coaching and financial well-being support
* Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
* Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need
* 20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy
* Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
* Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
* Career development and training opportunities


For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.



American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.



We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

title: Group Leader - Beacon Afterschool
description:
Group Leader - Beacon


Reports to: Beacon Program Director and Assistant Director


Work Location: Dr. Susan S. McKinney Secondary School of the Arts


101 Park Ave Brooklyn, NY 11205


Hours: Part-time - Minimum of 20 hours per week; Programing is offered every weekday from 2:00pm to 9:00pm, 10:00am - 6:00pm on weekends, and extended hours during the summer and school holidays. Must have availability to work Weekday/Afternoon/Evening and Saturdays


This position is fully in-person and does not offer any remote work.


Salary Range: $25/hour - $25/hour


**Position Summary**


Brooklyn Community Services is one of Brooklyn’s first and largest non-sectarian social services agencies. BCS, which presently serves more than 20,000 individuals annually, is committed to a broad and diverse range of services including education and child care; services to strengthen families; and services to foster self-sufficiency for adults.


Beacon Community Centers provide academic and recreational opportunities to children, teens, and adults. The Beacon program is offered every weekday from 2:00pm to 9:00pm, 10:00am - 6:00pm on weekends, and extended hours during the summer and school holidays.


**Responsibilities:**


* Work with Site Director and Assistant Director/On-site Supervisor to provide enriching activities for children, youth and adults during program hours.
* Assist with after school activities; help implement hands-on multi-sensory lessons and activities to children which are provided in the context of academically stimulating themes.
* Coordinate planning and preparation of activities and materials for daily schedule.
* Participate in creating lesson plans, activity facilitation, behavior management and professionalism.
* Provide effective supervision to groups of children during classroom activities, snack time, recreation and field trips.
* Responsible for taking and collecting daily attendance.
* Assist with developing and planning community events for children, parents and community as needed.
* Oversee and monitor authorized parental/guardian pick up of children.
* Supervises Activity Specialist and reinforce staff expectations
* Collect, review, and approve lesson plans.
* Assist specialist with group management and minor behavioral problems.
* Fills in for Activity Specialist if needed.
* Perform other duties as assigned.
* Reliable and able to work as a team member.

**Qualifications Required:**

* High school diploma; some college education preferred
* Must enjoy working with children and be able to pass a background check.
* Background in sports, music, drama, dance, photography, crafts, sewing, or the arts is a plus.

**BCS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Auxiliary aids and services are available upon request to individuals with disabilities.**

title: Analyst- Travel and Lifestyle Web Analytics
description:
**You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.**



With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.



At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.



Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.



This position is part of the Digital Customer Experience (DCX) team within Travel and Lifestyle Service. DCX is a dynamic part of the TLS organization, focusing on the end-to-end digital customer experience, encompassing the pre-booking, booking and post booking journey across AmexTravel.com, and 15 International Amex Travel websites.



**How will you make an impact in this role?**



As an Analyst on the DCX team, you will play a crucial role in analyzing and optimizing our digital customer experience. You will be responsible for managing web analytics, tracking key performance indicators (KPIs), owning tagging requirements, and driving data-informed improvements across our digital platforms.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* **Web Analytics Management:** Own the integrity and accuracy of web analytics data. Collaborate with technology engineers and cross-functional teams to ensure effective implementation and maintenance of Adobe Analytics, ensuring precise data collection and reporting.
* **Tagging Requirements:** Manage and oversee the implementation of tagging requirements across digital properties. Ensure that tags are correctly implemented and that data collected aligns with reporting and analytical needs.
* **Performance Tracking:** Monitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) related to user behavior, website performance, and marketing effectiveness. Proactively generate and present reports that provide actionable insights and support data-driven decision-making.
* **Data Analysis:** Conduct in-depth analysis of complex datasets from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and performance anomalies. Translate these insights into strategic recommendations to enhance the digital customer experience.
* **A/B Testing and Experimentation:** Lead the planning and execution of A/B tests and other experimental approaches to evaluate the impact of new features and optimizations. Use test results to make data-driven decisions and refine strategies for improving user experience.


**Minimum Qualifications**


* **Analytical Expertise:** Demonstrated ability to proactively identify and solve complex problems, with a talent for translating data into actionable insights.
* **Adobe Analytics Proficiency:** Extensive experience with Adobe Analytics, including its implementation, management, and reporting capabilities.
* **A/B Testing Experience:** Proven experience with A/B testing methodologies and tools such as Optimizely or Maximizer, with a strong track record of leveraging insights to drive improvements.
* **Tagging Experience:** Experience managing tagging implementations and ensuring that data collection is aligned with analytical and reporting requirements.
* **Communication Skills:** Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly convey complex data challenges and solutions to various stakeholders.
* **Data-Driven Approach:** Expertise in analyzing conversion-focused metrics, customer journey mapping, and understanding the role of marketing channels in driving traffic and conversions.
* **Adaptability:** A proactive, “can-do” attitude with strong ownership of responsibilities and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* **Passion for Travel:** Genuine enthusiasm for travel and a commitment to enhancing the digital customer experience.

title: Manager - Strategic Planning
description:
**You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.**



With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.



At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.



Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.



Global Commercial Services (GCS) is the global leader in providing payments solutions for Small, Medium and Large businesses. GCS is a core operating group of American Express and has delivered growth over the past decade. GCS partners with corporate and small business clients to help them manage cash flow and increase profitability through a variety of automated expense management tools.



Global Commercial Services and the Company continue to innovate and deliver a broad range of products and services to support the needs of all business customers. This is especially true for the US SME market, a dynamic set of customers across every industry segment. These customers are the backbone of our communities and a powerful driver of American Express’ overall financial performance and the economy as a whole.



**How will you make an impact on this role?**



The Manager - Strategic Planning, is responsible for developing and implementing strategies that drive efficiency and effectiveness across the US SME organizations, lead enterprise-wide collaboration where necessary, and support our long-term growth plans. This is a critical role in ensuring the US SME organization is well positioned to deliver for our shareholders, customers, and business. The Manager- Strategic Planning work with senior leaders in US SME as well as teams across GCS and the broader American Express organization.


**Responsibilities:**



* Develop impactful presentations, content, agendas, and internal processes for key internal and external meetings (e.g. Senior leadership meetings)
* Groom and prioritize opportunity sets with compelling customer, colleague, and shareholder value propositions.
* Socialize these ideas with senior leadership and colleagues across US SME and the Company.
* Use that feedback to build consensus and commitment on a roadmap and overall strategy for US SME.
* Build and implement implementation plans to deliver results, outcomes, and monitor and report out on results.
  


**Minimum Qualifications****:**



* 5+ years professional experience, preferably with exposure to sales, B2B marketing and corporate strategy. It is expected that past experience has built exceptional communication skills, people leadership, and an ability to successfully prioritize and project manage
* Experience driving matrixed change across multiple groups, partners, and leadership levels
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPoint.
* Success at developing and evaluating strategies across dimensions including growth, customer experience, financial, and risk management, amongst others.
* An ability to inspire balanced dialogue across all these dimensions and ensuring all necessary perspectives are brought to the table.
* Experience communicating with senior internal and external partners and an ability to influence and direct prioritization decisions and outcomes.
* Self-motivated, enthusiastic and creative with a demonstrated ability to get results under tight timelines and in particular handle multiple tasks concurrently.
* A Bachelor’s degree required


**Preferred Qualifications****:**



* MBA preferred


* *Sr. Manager level may be considered depending upon experience*



Salary Range: $80,000.00 to $155,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits



The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we’ll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.



Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions



We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:


* Competitive base salaries
* Bonus incentives
* 6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
* Free financial coaching and financial well-being support
* Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
* Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need
* 20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy
* Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
* Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
* Career development and training opportunities


For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.



American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.



We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.



US Job Seekers/Employees - Click here to view the “Know Your Rights” poster and the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.



If the links do not work, please copy and paste the following URLs in a new browser window: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters to access the three posters.
company_description: At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.

title: Executive Office Manager
description:
We are seeking a highly organized and proactive individual to fill the role of Office Admin with Executive Assistant responsibilities at Leverage Companies, a fast-growing real estate private equity start-up. This position offers significant growth opportunities for the right candidate who can efficiently manage office operations while providing dedicated support to executives. The ideal candidate will excel in multitasking, possess excellent communication skills, and be capable of handling a variety of responsibilities to ensure the smooth functioning of the office environment.

Qualifications

* Proven experience as an Office Manager, Executive Assistant, or in another relevant administrative role.
* Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and familiarity with office management software.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and act with discretion.
* Professional demeanor and strong interpersonal skills.

Responsibilities  
Office Management:

* Oversee day-to-day office operations, ensuring a productive and well-maintained work environment.
* Manage office supplies, equipment, and facilities to ensure a seamless workflow.
* Implement and improve office policies and procedures for increased efficiency.
* Keep stock of office inventory and order replacements when necessary.
* Maintain office tidiness, ensuring the office is neat, presentable, and organized at all times.
* Assist in preparation for office guest visits and critical executive meetings.

Executive Assistance:

* Provide high-level administrative support to the CEO, including managing calendars, scheduling meetings, and coordinating travel arrangements.
* Screen and prioritize incoming communications, handling or redirecting as appropriate.
* Act as a liaison between executives and internal/external stakeholders, demonstrating professionalism and confidentiality.

Administrative Duties:

* Prepare and send out ARIP packages.
* Create and organize Acquisition Manager folders.
* Manage business card orders and ensure timely distribution.
* Oversee payments for parking and rent.
* Reorder parking passes as needed.
* Coordinate and schedule 1:1 meetings.
* Maintain and update the inventory list regularly.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $15.00 - $18.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 – 50 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Office Administration: 1 year (Preferred)
* Executive administrative support: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Newark, NJ 07102 (Required)

Work Location: In person
company_description: Leverage Companies is a data-driven upstart PropTech and value-add investment firm innovating the way real estate is done.

title: Lecturer/Clinical - Nursing --Florham and Metro Campuses--Fall 2024
description:
The responsibilities of a nursing faculty include teaching and service. We seek a faculty member who can teach across entry- and advanced-level programs within a population focus or other area of expertise, and is comfortable with both didactic and clinical instruction, as well as the oversight of clinical preceptors.  

The faculty member will be effective in teaching and mentoring diverse students using multiple methods (i.e., both online and in-person modalities); develop curricula; engage in university service; and participate in accreditation-related processes.  

Required Qualifications:
**MINIMUM** **and** **PREFERRED****QUALIFICATIONS**:
1. Required: An earned Master’s degree in nursing.
2. Preferred: An earned doctoral degree.
3. Required: Current New Jersey registered nurse license.
4. Preferred: Advanced practice nursing certification (nurse practitioner, clinical nurse specialist, nurse midwifery)
5. Required: Demonstrated teaching effectiveness.
6. Required: Proficiency in the use of computer systems for spreadsheets, word processing, internet, videoconferencing, and e-mail.
7. Required: Ability to manage sensitive issues with decorum and confidentiality.
8. Required: Well organized, independent, and collaborative in carrying out responsibilities.  

NOTE: Employment is contingent upon a satisfactory background check. Candidates for hire will be required to sign a waiver authorizing the background check and produce a Social Security Card.
Preferred Qualifications: Hours Worked Posting Date: 04/24/2024 Special Instructions to Applicants:
Lecturer for both Florham and Metro campuses  

  

Please submit a statement of up to 500 words about your experience in and/or commitment to teaching and caring for communities of diverse learners  

Application Types Accepted: Faculty Profile
